alert.note: Alert for Elkhead and Park Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Routt County through 445 PM MDT... At 408 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Hog Park Campground, or 44 miles northeast of Craig. THe storm is remaining fairly stationary HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Torrential rainfall will accompany this storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Routt County, including the following locations... Hahns Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
